name: DIY Device
description: This device lets you create your own, custom driver to work with any SNMP-power device that you know OIDs of.

features.description: This is required for all devices. OID entered will be used to get tree (snmpwalk), each returned leafâ€™s last address bit will be used as port id for get/set calls below
Use {$port} variable in OID in place where this tool should enter port to get port state of. Enter integer values returned by call representing ON/OFF states
Use {$port} variable in OID in place where this tool should enter port to set port state of. Enter integer values which should be written to given OID to perform On/Of
Use {$port} variable in OID in place where this tool should enter port to get value from. Select what sort of unit your device returns via SNMP
Use {$port} variable in OID in place where this tool should enter port to get value from. Select what sort of unit your device returns via SNMP
If you plan to use power billing, and your divice only supports per-port voltage and current readouts, do not set this checkbox - Power Collector module will calculate usage from those readouts
Use {$port} variable in OID in place where this tool should enter port to get value from. Select what sort of unit your device returns via SNMP
Use {$port} variable in OID in place where this tool should enter port to get value from. Select what sort of unit your device returns via SNMP
